etymology.description: Classical interpretation: 犬 (“dog”) guarding four 口 (“vessels”). Alternate views: phonetically borrowed for “to bark”; or derived from 喪 as an ideogram referring to a funerary urn.
etymology.interpretation: Traditionally viewed as a dog watching over four containers, conveying the idea of utensils or vessels. Some scholars instead see a phonetic loan for barking later repurposed to mean implements, or an ideogram tied to mourning and a funerary urn; the modern sense aligns well with the container imagery.

examples.chinese: 这个容器很密封(這個容器很密封)。
实验室需要更多精密仪器(實驗室需要更多精密儀器)。
examples.pinyin: Shíyànshì xūyào gèng duō jīngmì yíqì.
examples.english: The laboratory needs more precision instruments.

examples.chinese: 请把餐具放回器皿里(請把餐具放回器皿裡)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng bǎ cānjù fàng huí qìmǐn lǐ.
examples.english: Please put the tableware back into the vessels.
